FULLmetallica: I had the same problem since I run the game on XP. What you want to do is to find the fallout.exe file (in the folder wherein you installed the game). Right-click it. Select properties and then Compatibility. Change the Compatibility Mode to Win95. Done!

Something's wicked screwed here, and it seems no one answered this problem. Please. If you know how to get around this, tell us all. 

In daemon tools, I go to "all files". When I open the img. file, the install menu comes up. I click install, and nothing happens, eventually, stuff freezes up. I have to reboot my com every time - what do I do?

Aha, got it.
Daemon tools, mount image
then when you go to choose what to open, switch the file types all the way to the bottom to  'all files',  then mount the .img file itself.
No converting or anything needed.
game runs great!

For those that can't play the game, run it in compatibility mode for windows 98.
Right click on the file you use to run the game, go to compatibility and choose from there.
Works perfectly!

Ok, after a (painful ! :p) search, I managed to solve my problem. So if you encounter a pb like mine, here what you can try :
edit fallout2.cfg and delete the line "art_cache_size=1047".

For those who are having problems installing saying, "I hit install and it freezes", there is a solution. 

1.Mount the img file onto a virtual mounter

2.Exit the program that opens when you have mounted the img file

3.Go into My Computers and find the disk drive that has the Fallout 2 img file mounted onto it.

4. Right click it and hit explore.

5.Double Click SETUP.EXE

6. An error message will appear so just hit continue.

7.Install and enjoy!

nevermind, I found out what you have to do.
If you click the Install button and your computer freezes, just do this.

1. After you mount the .img file (Use Daemon tools, then click the option to "show everything."
2. Open up the CD-Rom that it is in.
3. Click the Setup button
4. Install from there
I recomend the Large installation, but the others are good too.

thanks

- Mount and install to any location.

- Open the install dir and delete the ereg files.
(So it will not bug you each time you start)

- Crash explorer.exe using the task manager.
- File --> New task ---> and enter path to your game.
(Example: E:\Games\Fallout2\fallout2.exe)

Now the game will launch without mixed up colors and without ereg crap.

Enjoy. :)

To open the image with Daemon Tools you just have to change the file extensions filter. On the "select image file" dialog, click "All  supported files" and change it to "All files". Should mount ok.
